definitions.definition: matter, material, articles, or activities of a specified or indeterminate kind that are being referred to, indicated, or implied.
examples: a pickup truck picked the stuff up

definitions.definition: a person's belongings, equipment, or baggage.
examples: he took his stuff and went
synonyms: things "all my stuff is in the suitcase"

definitions.definition: worthless or foolish ideas, speech, or writing; rubbish.
drink or drugs.
things in which one is knowledgeable and experienced; one's area of expertise.
examples: noun: one's stuff; plural noun: one's stuffs

definitions.definition: the basic constituents or characteristics of something or someone.
examples: Healey was made of sterner stuff

definitions.definition: woolen fabric, especially as distinct from silk, cotton, and linen.
(in sports) spin given to a ball to make it vary its course.
a pitcher's ability to produce spin on a ball or control the speed of delivery of a pitch.
fill (a receptacle or space) tightly with something.
examples: an old teapot stuffed full of cash

definitions.definition: force or cram (something) tightly into a receptacle or space.
examples: he stuffed a thick wad of cash into his jacket pocket
synonyms: stick "Robyn stuffed her clothes into a bag"

definitions.definition: hastily or clumsily push (something) into a space.
examples: Sadie took the coin and stuffed it in her coat pocket

definitions.definition: fill (the cavity of an item of food) with a savory or sweet mixture, especially before cooking.
examples: chicken stuffed with mushrooms and breadcrumbs

definitions.definition: fill (oneself) with large amounts of food.
examples: he stuffed himself with potato chips
synonyms: make a pig of oneself with/on "they stuffed themselves with chocolate"

definitions.definition: fill out the skin of (a dead animal or bird) with material to restore the original shape and appearance.
examples: he took the bird to a taxidermist to be stuffed

definitions.definition: fill (envelopes) with identical copies of printed matter.
examples: they spent the whole time in a back room stuffing envelopes

definitions.definition: place bogus votes in (a ballot box).
(of a man) have sexual intercourse with (someone).
defeat heavily in sport.
used to express indifference toward or rejection of (something).
